newsitem.title: POLAND: BRE buys stake in small energy sector bank.
newsitem.headline: BRE buys stake in small energy sector bank.

text.p: Bank Rozwoju Exportu SA (BRE) has paid about nine million zlotys for a 26.18 percent stake of Bank Energetyki SA (BEN), which mostly services Poland's energy sector, BRE's president said on Wednesday.
"I am pleased that we were picked as the strategic investor in BEN," Krzysztof Szwarc told a news conference.
BEN, whose share capital rose to 52 million zlotys after BRE bought 60,000 of its shares, will also get technical assistance, training from BRE, he said.
BRE will also co-operate with the smaller bank on forex, money and T-bill market operations.
BEN's largest shareholders and its main clients include the Polish Power Grid (PSE), state-owned power plants and other energy sector firms.
